Reviews.Title: “Quite stunning! - For the wrong reasons. Disgraceful”
Reviews.Author: Lisa F
Reviews.Content: I travel to Italy,Venice and many other resorts worldwide many times a year and have eaten in some of the finest restaurants. Last September we decided to try the Hotel Cipriani, my partner having been there some 20 years before having a very positive experience.We use trip advisor a lot and it is usually very accurate - Not on this occasion I can assure you. One of the most disappointing experiences and meals I have ever had. We booked a table for dinner overlooking the wonderful lagoon. In terms of location you couldn't ask for better. The private boat driver was courteous and the bar drinks and snacks were good. However this service did not extend to the restaurant. We ordered two starters and two main courses with a lovely bottle of wine. The starters were mediocre to say the least. Just as we put our cutlery down the main course had arrived. When we expressed disappointment that it had arrived so quickly with no break the waiter replied "you should have told us if you wanted to eat slowly". They took the main courses back and some 15 minutes brought it back to the table, having obviously been reheated! Disgraceful. Rice had become a complete blob with overcooked fish. To try and mask this they had poured melted butter to separate the rice grains. This was then inedible and certainly not what you would expect from a quality hotel/restaurant. When we complained to the waiter we were met with discourtesy and rudeness saying essentially that it was "the cipriani hotel and they had a good reputation". I would argue that the Cipriani was very good in its day - but it has become over confident and mediocre. I suspect that it will continue to have customers based on location rather than quality of food. It needs to come up with the times. I would be extremely surprised if they had many return guests.Unfortunately due to the number of visitors to Venice, particularly from America they will always turn over a reasonable amount. An extremely disappointing, overpriced, pompous resort that needs to buck up its ideas and treat its customers with more courtesy. It is such a shame as the location is wonderful. If you could move Osteria Santa Marina, which is a wonderful restaurant there you would have perfection. I will never return and I will ensure that my friends and family are not subjected to the same experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Italian luxury”
Reviews.Author: PIXSQUARED
Reviews.Content: Venise is one of my favorite place on the planet. If you go there in summer the best place to stay is Cipriani for 2 main reasons one is you can profit from the almost olympic swimming pool and secondly when you have enough of the crowd you take the hotel riva and you go back on the Cipriani island. And vis et versa, when you want to escape from the oasis of the palace and go shopping you take the boat. ALso the the restaurant are delicious.

Reviews.Title: “The best service we have ever had!”
Reviews.Author: PickyTraveler1965
Reviews.Content: It was a once in a lifetime trip for us. With 6 of us traveling it was also logistically difficult. The Staff at the Cipriani met us with a private boat and someone to handle our luggage just as we disembarked from our Cruise boat which we had sailed round out of the port in Venice. They gave us an immediate feeling of being taken care of and our relaxing and luxurious stay at the Cipriani began. Elegant, attentive, luxurious, accommodating and gorgeous are some of the words that come to mind. We have never felt more at ease and cared for while traveling. Our 80 year old mother, 22 year old Nanny, 4 year old and 6 month old were welcomed and all accommodations were made for their comfort and appetites. My husband and I dined on the Terrace facing St Marks Square and delighted in every mouth watering bite of food and every sip of wine. We also found the pool, the only pool in Venice to be fabulous and the cabanas with waiters attending to us comfortable and private. The Cipriani if you can afford it is well worth every penny spent!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZED ME”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey P
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in late June and it was amazing. I spent 3 nights in a room with an amazing view of the gardens. I was with parents and a sister on a trip to Venice. Every day, we would take the boat, and once or twice the vapparetto to the the city. The pool at the hotel is quite nice, even though it was rather cloudy the day we visited it. The rooms were amazing. They were well decorated and very large compared to other hotels in Italy. I did not eat dinner at the restaurant, but did have breakfast, which was amazing. The only thing is that it is REALLY EXPENSIVE!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence all around”
Reviews.Author: Neil T
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights as a preclude to a trp on the Orient Xpress to Paris. Our stay at the Cip was wonderful with charming staff from the moment we stepped off our water taxi from airport. The rooms were very good, and facilities around the hotel what you wold expect. We spent some time in the piano bar one evening and this was,enjoyable, if not packed, due to the very entertaining singer/pianist. Would really recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Venice who's budget will cater for the extraganvences of the Cip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent four days vacation”
Reviews.Author: MartinN34
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cipriani is the best hotel in Venice. Very romantic place with charming view around, great service, amazing food and the best place where you can share your pleasure with your love. Perfect hotel would love go back!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: 2aspen
Reviews.Content: We had a meal for 19 of us here which the hotel arranged along with drinks and canapes. It was absolutely fantastic. The food was great, the service faultless. 10 of us then stayed for 2 nights before 6 of us went on to the Orient Express to Paris. The hotel pool is amazing, and we had garden rooms which were beautiful. The bar is great, with the guy entertaining on the piano, we had great fun dancing and singing. Drinks in the bar not cheap but this is the Cipriani so was what we expected. The boat service available to and from San Marco square is regular and well manned. Perfect hotel would go back tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “A Must In Hot Weather”
Reviews.Author: Venamo
Reviews.Content: For 30 years and 30 trips to Venice I always avoided the Cip. One nagging thought was always the price. Venice is expensive, but the Cip raised its room rates to the almost ludicrous level. More particularly was its location on the Guidecca. One had to take its launch or a vaproetta to get there. I loved walking out of the Luna or Bauer, or Europa and being right in the flow. For me even the Gritti was a bridge too far. Thjn last year I tried it and I am now a convert. Sitting at its new less formal Cip's Club watching night fall and the stars shine over the Venice's fabled skyline is such a special treat. And our room #38 matched the fabulous view and food at Cip's Club. Our on patio, hot tub and a beutiful view back onto the water, was a treat to luxuriate in. The service was impeccable and all the facilities in good repair (something not always easy to do in Venice). Sitting by the pool for lunch or a late afternoon sun when St Mark's was too hot and cowded was a pleasant break and did not make me feel like I was escaping wasting my precious time in Venice in an equally precious place. Insteasd it enhanced my stay. The ferry to and from St Mark's was fast, friendly and easy and I never felt that somehow I was not right in the action. Definitely going back. Especially in the hotter times in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Has to be best hotel location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: pitliver
Reviews.Content: Somewhat belated review... This was the last stop on our fabulous Orient Express trip from Istanbul. I understand that this is one of only 2 hotels in Venice to have a Swimming pool and our room with private patio and direct access to pool and dedicated loungers was fantastic..if not a little dated and tatty! The hotels private water taxi to the square is a fantastic bonus! Nice to be away from the madness that can be Venice but near enough to enjoy it. A private water taxi to the airport from the hotel is a must, and worth every single penny!!...(or 100 odd pounds)..trust me..it is!

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: smokeyrolo
Reviews.Content: Having had a wonderful journey to Venice aboard the Venice Simplon-Orient Express from London, the beautiful Cipriani was waiting our arrival. We were met outside central station by private launch and taken to this wonderful hotel. The view of Venice were just incredible. Upon check-in we were taken personally to our room which was perfectly appointed with a private balcony overlooking Venice grand canal. This hotel is five star and so very civilised. It has the biggest lane pool of any hotel in Venice. The staff were very attentive and nothing was too much trouble. We had a very relaxing time here in wonderful Venice. The funniest thing was the sheer cost of incidentals like tea or water, throw in biscuits and you should need to notify your bank manager before proceeding with the purchase!

Reviews.Title: “Favourite hotel in Italy”
Reviews.Author: Nevermissameal
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a few times and the hotel staff go out of their way to welcome you back making the whole experience even better. Yes, some of the rooms are a little dated but I believe the hotel is slowly renovating them. The location of the hotel, away from the hustle and bustle of the city, especially during the summer, cannot be overstated. We love this place. Period.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Excellent Property! Beautiful and luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: James B
Reviews.Content: St. Mark's Square hotels and restaurants are just a gondola ride away....Super great restaurants, and the pool scene is super fun! LOVE IT! Would visit again, definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: poshredkitty
Reviews.Content: The legacy of this hotel tied in with the Orient Express train from Paris - Venice is a glamourous package to be sure. But the hotel on it's own is pretty much a typical 5* hotel in terms of service and amenities that one would expect anyway. Stayed here for 3 nights in early November 2011 and hotel was nice and rooms were lovely. Service in the restaurants are a bit hit and miss but generally ok if you ask to speak with the restaurant manager as it then gets sorted out pretty quickly. Just be aware that you are not near where all the main attractions in Venice are so it's always a bit of a traipse getting about the sights even with the hotel boat. Personally I would only stay here if I'm not doing much in the main attractions like San Marco or Accademia etc districts. Very nice if you want to get away from the madding crowds in those main areas. Really cool to arrive on their own hotel boat by private transfer.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: TravelPhil
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cipriani after travelling to Venice on the Orient Express and one of the notable benefits was the seamless transition from train to hotel, at an earlier stop (Verona I think) representatives of the hotel boarded the train and duing the last leg to Venice visited the compartments of Cipriani guests and conducted the check in formalities so when we arrived at the hotel we simply collected our key and were taken straight to our room... superb! Cipriani is amazing! Our room had a separate glass conservatory where we had breakfast each morning and outside was a large patio area with loungers, table and chairs and a jacuzzi. We tried both restaurants and were very satified with Cips club and truly amazed by the main hotel restaurant- fabulous food and superb service. All the staff were very friendly and helpful and the private launch over to St Marks square was so useful and convenient. Would return in an instant and next time we visit Venice it has to be the Cipriani! Just one caveat - its expensive, very expensive, if you are on a budget its probably not for you, but if you can afford it and want the best, or a once in a lifetime experience (a bit like the Orient express) you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “A truly great hotel”
Reviews.Author: IanSmith_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real class act from the friendly discreet and family oriented staff to the comfortable rooms and good food, this hotel takes a lot of boxes. We all want to return to this stunning venue.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful honeymoon hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynne141
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon after taking the Orient Express to Venice. Although only here for two nights it was quite magical. We had booked a double garden view room but when we arrived late at night we were given the most beautiful suite overlooking the lagoon complete with chocolate heart shaped cake, pink champagne and a lovely note from the manager wishing us a romantic honeymoon. The service was second to none and nothing was too much trouble for the staff. We enjoyed a full cooked breakfast in our room both mornings we stayed and enjoyed cocktails and coffee in the pool bar of an evening. Although we did not eat at the hotel we heard from other guests that it was second to none. The turn down service of an evening was excellent, down to slippers placed by your bed and complimentary robe laid out for you. Bulgari toiletries were replenished daily when opened as was the fizzy and still water bottles placed each side of the bed. An enchanting place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “I love Cipriani....”
Reviews.Author: ami s
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this enchanted place towards the end of September. I think I can say that the Hotel Cipriani is one of the nicest places I have ever stayed. Staff and service excellent, food fantastic.A step away from Piazza San Marco. I also recommend a walk in the garden and enjoy the relaxation of this enchanted. Fairytale atmosphere. I love the Cipriani

Reviews.Title: “Stay in September 2011”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous190737
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful magical hotel. We were there during the Venic Film Festival which I didn't know was on at that time till we got there. And there were so many people in Venice that it was so nice to get back to the tranquil hotel.The staff is amazing. We had a garden room thanks to our daughter with our own little terrace and private lounge chairs by the pool. I left a dess at the hotel and they found it and shipped it back to me ASAP. When you walk through the gardens it is amazing and serene. They grow their own herbs and vegetables in garden for the restaurant.We spent our last night eating at the restaurant on the waterfront and there again the service was truly amazingThe shuttle that takes you back and forth is a Godsend. I was on this shuttle boat and there were some people off of a cruise ship who obviously came to look at the hotel and their comments were as they returned to Venic said "Now back to reality". Was the highlight of our stay in Italy

Reviews.Title: “Roberto, you are amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Caroline012
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the Cipriani hotel and it is a truly amazing place with exceptional staff too. Especially a warm thank you to Roberto who takes care of all your needs with his Italian flair. He even showed me that I could zoom in with my i phone (I was unaware of that!) to make a picture of my parents while they were watching the breathtaking view of the lagoon. We had lunch and dinner in both restaurants and loved the food and the ambiance. Breakfast is superb at the Cipriani. The suites were very beautifully decorated and comfortable, and so was the enormous pool area! We would highly recommend this hotel as being the best you can find in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DORDubai
Reviews.Content: Visiting friends on their return of Orient express trip and stayed night before the seasonal closure of the property (November). I had excelent time in the property and the F&B was great.For romantic get-aways and special occasions this property is classic in Venice. Just avoid it during Cannes film festival, the rates are very high and it is booked by celebrities. When you finish your touristic Venice trip, it is nice to stay for even one night in thsi lovely quite place out of all hassle and bassel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay â€“ exquisite hotel”
Reviews.Author: carotravel1
Reviews.Content: A fabulous stay. Everything was right about this hotel (but be warned, it is expensive, but still good value). Gorgeous location, delicious food, excellent friendly service throughout. The management is top notch, personal and utterly professional. Exceeded our expectations (as well as our budget, but absolutely worth it!)

Reviews.Title: “An elegant & charming hotel, which is now slightly faded.”
Reviews.Author: madeleine_rijndorp
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel in a beautiful position. The friendly, efficient and smiling staff could not have been more helpful. The setting is gorgeous with the best/biggest outside swimming pool imaginable. But what a shame that the Orient Express group has let the furnishing and and hotel interior become faded. A large stained/marked mirror in our bathroom. Braid hanging off the bedside light. Worn lounge chairs on the outside terrace. Thin, cheap white bath towels. And yet beautiful bath accessories by Bvlgari and crisp white sheets changed daily. And everything was very clean - as it should be. But why did they give us NEW bath slippers every day - where do the old ones go? For the 3 nights we were there one pair would have been perfectly adequate. Breakfast was great, with an enormous selection. The main restaurant food and service were good. The snack bar by the pool was good - but CIPS restaurant served us absolutely disgusting food which was definitely not cooked by a chef. (Clam soup was a bowl of clams covered with a tin of tomatoes. Braised liver was half a plate of grey chopped up liver with half a plate of congealed polenta). The Orient Express is fortunate to have the best positioned hotel in Venice - the boat trip to and from the main part of Venice absolutely makes the holiday more enjoyable. This hotel used to be magnificent, so why have they let things slip? It 's a great shame and inexcusable and clearly due to bad management. However, the Cipriani is still a lovely place to stay. Tranquil, charming and elegant but very slightly faded.

Reviews.Title: “"The best"”
Reviews.Author: billiverstravels
Reviews.Content: I am happiest when I am on the water, so Venice is my kind of town and I was in my element the two or four times we would hop on the hotel's private water taxi to cross the Guidecca Canal straight out from San Marco. The Hotel Cipriani is simply the best. I've also stayed at the Danieli and can now confidently say "Danieli, you have been bested!". I doubt the Cip could have been much better in an aspect. I could go into detail, but it would be a very boring review with so many superlatives. Biggest surprise: You can use the pool 24 hours! Midnight swim, anyone?

Reviews.Title: “The real luxury? Having a Public Relations Manager”
Reviews.Author: Angie B
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in this wonderful hotel for a couple of days and although the high season in Venice, the relaxing atmosphere and the gentleness of the staff made me feel the unique client at the hotel! That is the word: I felt UNIQUE! But The real luxury was meeting Laura DiBert, Public Relations Manager of the hotel. She suggested us only local tips,(that we carefully followed), she dedicated to us attention and professionalism that in no place in the world I could find, not even in Mandarin Oriental, where we normally stay! She was able to recreate romantic situations for me and my husband (surprising us almost every day) and at the same time make my children at the Kids Club the happiest in the world. The entire family did not want to leave the Cipriani, our new discovered treasure. And we are sure now that we will come back because real luxury is Laura and all the amazing staff! I suggest the Cipriani for romantic break or for a family holiday. In both cases it exceeds the expectations.

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to go back the the Cipriani!”
Reviews.Author: Ann G
Reviews.Content: My husband, two daughters and I arrived at the Cipriani on July 27th 2011 for an eight-day stay. From the moment Roberto greeted us when our motor launch arrived at the hotel, we felt as if we were in Paradise. The hotel exudes glamour and the service is impeccable. We had interconnecting rooms with fabulous views of the Lagoon and enjoyed delicious al fresco breakfasts, watching various motorcraft go by as the sun glistened on the water. We did not feel the need to dine anywhere other than the hotel and loved both Cipâ€™s Club and the Fortuny for their excellent menus and attentive staff. Sipping Bellini cocktails at Cipâ€™s Club and watching the sun setting over Venice is a great way to end the day. Nothing was too much trouble for the superb staff. We had booked our holiday through Elegant Resorts and our travel consultant had liaised with the Concierge team, who ensured our tour guides and various museum tickets were all in place ahead of our visit. When we suddenly realised that Sting was performing his Symphonicity Concert in St. Markâ€™s Square on the third evening of our holiday, the wonderful Roberto spent time on his day off sourcing tickets for us, for what proved to be a memorable evening. We were certainly well looked after. The hotelâ€™s launch is available to whisk you across to St. Markâ€™s Square within a few minutes and it is a great feeling to rejoin the launch and escape all the crowds and head back to the calm world of the Cipriani and its glorious pool and gardens. With Sting a mere table away during lunch at the poolside restaurant ahead of his concert and then at breakfast the morning after, we too felt like rock stars and canâ€™t wait for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: christine l
Reviews.Content: Our family of five had the most wonderful time! The ambiance is superlative and service even better. We were so impressed by the warm welcome we received by the entire hotel staff, including Roberto and Gianni. What a pleasure to have them arrange the perfect 18th birthday for my son at Cips. It was so great to be able to leave the busy island to return to this elegant oasis across the grand canal. I can't imagine staying anywhere but here in Venice!! Thank you to everyone for making our trip unforgettable. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Venice - comes w/ a price though”
Reviews.Author: christaSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Cipriani 2 nights before a Seabourn Cruise to Athens and after the 2 nights we did not want to leave at all. The service is very classy, personal and elegant without being intrusive though. From Roberto, whom you just have to like, to the pool crew and housekeeping: They all seemed to really know and to CARE what they were doing. They were each and everyone very devoted to their work. Value for money has never been good in any of the top hotels in Italy, be it the Hassler, the Caruso, Villa d'Este, Splendido Royale etc. So forget about that. If you can afford it go and just pay for it - This hotel is pure "Italianita"! The pool and the nice gardens are paradise during the hot summer months. And since the boat to Piazza San Marco is running all the time, one is in the city within minutes. Food at the Cips was very good; Fortunity was so so. We were celebrating our anniversary and they upgraded us to a beautiful suite at the Palazzo Vendramin w/ a lovely view of the canal. Here every guest is treated like royalty, also if your name is not Brad Pitt or George Clooney, though you my well be coming across one of them during your visit. We also liked the place because it only has 90somthing rooms and is very personal w/ the GM always being around and checking on people. We will be back! Thank you very much Cipriani - Team!!

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Bar None”
Reviews.Author: pelorus68Herts_Uk
Reviews.Content: I had the dubious pleasure of having going to the Fortuny bar at TheCipriani for drinks on 7 July before heading off for dinner. The service was nothing short of appalling with many bar guests commenting behind us about dreadful, inattentive staff - we left after only one drink having had empty glasses for over 10 mins and trying to wave for service. Restaurant guests waiting at the door, ignored for over 5 mins to be seated, other guests topping up their own wine and water and starter plates left for over 15 minutes. No leadership or direction - in short an utter shambles. To cap it off I wrote an email to the GM - Mr Ottazzo who has taken 3 weeks to "respond" - stating that a series of unfortunate events and a shower caused this chaos. He asked for no further details or information about our visit other than to confirm where we were sitting. In my opinion - it all starts and finishes at the top.......... Particularly at the top end of the market. We are returning to Venice this winter, but will not be returning to The Cipriani.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in goregous setting”
Reviews.Author: NiamhfromIreland
Reviews.Content: The private boat trip from St Marks Square bringing us to the hotel set the scene for our stay and it was luxury all the way. The boat is available 24 hours a day to drop you over and back to St Marks Square at a whim. The Cips Club restaurant is breath taking and a must if you're staying at this hotel. Guests are allowed use the outdoor pool 24 hours a day and it's always warm. The only negative is that we extended our stay by 2 nights and unfortunately we had to move out of our room from the main hotel to a very small chalet type room on the grounds which wasn't at the same level. It ain't cheap.

Reviews.Title: “This must be the best hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: EnjoytravelUk
Reviews.Content: This hotel totally exceeded our expectations. The Cipriani staff are exceptional, and the hotel a joy to stay in. Their communication skills are second to none, we only had to make a request and very quickly the staff who needed to action our request were aware and made outstanding effort to deliver beyond our expectations every time. Particularly to be praised are the reception and restaurant staff. Although we usually organise our own travel, we decided to book this trip through Citalia, who were excellent every step of the way, all the arrangements went smoothly and we arrived home fully refreshed after just 3 days in Venice. The reviews often recommend that you dont visit Venice in August. We disagree, the weather that time of year is warm and the Cipriani on Guidecca island is the perfect antidote to the hussle & bustle of San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: Den61_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in June our suite,service,food and the hotel itself were just our of this world. Return trip is a must. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless service in serene surroundings”
Reviews.Author: wroth
Reviews.Content: Venice is extraordinary but can be wearing with the crowds. The Cipriani, located on an island, solves everything! Once you have reached your Venicesightseeing limit, the private Cipriani boat wisks you to your private slice of heavenin about 4 minutes. There, we basked in the amazing service, swam in the enormous pool and walked through the lush gardens. Nothing is overlooked..nothing! Yes you will pay dearly but, if you can, just do it.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable luxury and pampering”
Reviews.Author: lovesusa
Reviews.Content: This hotel could certainly show lots of other hotels and restaurants how it really should be done. This stay was part of a trip on the Orient Express (will do a review for this soon) for a special anniversary and it certainly was the most special place I have ever stayed in. From the moment we were greeted by name and led to a cool room for a welcoming drink and then shown our suite we were totally cossetted and pampered. we were shown to our room by a member of the management, shown how everything worked and asked to let them know if there was anything we needed - there wasn't, everything had been thought of and was available in the suite. Luggage arrived moments later whilst we relaxed on one of 2 terraces with our complimentary wine and nibbles. The suite itself consisted of a sitting room with its own bar area and crystal glasses, a desk and very comfortable furniture and plenty of reading lamps. The bedroom was very large, the bed was huge and very comfortable and this led to a dressing area, huge and very powerful shower, bath and vanity units. and a separate toilet. Again plenty of room in the bathroom for 2 to not fall over each other. Lots of lovely bits and pieces - Molton Brown and Bvalgari - again nothing else you could need. The Cipriani is on an island opposite St Marks Square and has its own boat which is available 24 hours a day on demand.. They have their own mooring at the front of St Marks Square and if you arrive there and the boat isn't there you just lift up the phone and ask for it, its then sent over for you (5 to 10 mins) straight away. There is always someone to help you get off the boat at the other end. Breakfasts are taken in the garden overlooking the lagoon, or in your room for no extra charge if you want, and there is an enormous amount of choice. After only one breakfast we were greeted as regulars each time we appeared and how we liked our coffee etc was remembered! We also had dinner one evening here and the ambience is so peaceful and welcoming, the views fantastic and the staff service friendly and impeccable. The hotel has its own large pool ( a luxury in Venice) with very attentive and helpful staff and service for drinks etc here is very quick. We were even accompanied back to the airport in the hotels boat and transferred about 100yards, which we have always walked on past visits, by car. For anyone with a special occasion or even wanting to feel their hard earned money has been well spent, this is the place!!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Find Fault”
Reviews.Author: 43reds
Reviews.Content: Rooms are gorgeous and glorious. We stayed in the Palezzo rather than the main hotel building -- was at first put out when I we took the long garden walk to get there, but that ended as soon as I saw the room and the awesome views of the city. The bathrooms are enormous and have an obscenely large basket of great products, and the red marble is lovely. The little touches make the difference, including the spray of orchids on the rim of the bathtub. The pool -- the only one in Venice -- is an amazing place to watch people (a lot of rich old men with young beautiful women!) and relish the sense that there are only a few moments this lovely in life. The staff is crisp and professional, with just a dash of the imperiousness one often encounters at hotels of this caliber. Do take some time to walk about the gardens and property - there are small fountains and little Murano glass delights everywhere. It's great fun to eat at the pool restaurant and watch the boats go by -- best club sandwich ever -- and the private launch across the canal is fast and reliable. It was hard to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Another bit of paradise on earth”
Reviews.Author: elfinEngland
Reviews.Content: What a treat! A surprise trip to Venice and a stay at the Cipriani-simply brilliant. The arrival by private launch, the views, the tranquillity of the fantastic gardens, bellinis by the pool followed by delicious lunches-I could go on and on! We missed the dinner around the pool on the 21st. I am sure it was spectacluar. Would I recommend it and go again? Yes!!! Elfin

Reviews.Title: “even better than before and much better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: Lyncthom
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been regulars at the Cipriani for many years and have always enjoyed the hotel and the highly personalized service one experiences there. However until this Easter when we have traveled to Venice with our children (three under ten) we have stayed elsewhere as we found the Cipriani unwelcoming to young children. Since the change in management, all has changed and the Cipriani has become the exemplar of a child-friendly hotel. I never thought I would be able to take my children to dine in the Fortuny Restaurant for dinner but this year we did. All in all the experience has been transformed and the chintzy room designs of the past consigned to history. From Roberto when one's water-taxi arrives to the pool attendant the service is now much more aligned to those of the Ritz-Carlton and the Four Seasons, the gold standard for service internationally. Well done to all at the Cipriani!

Reviews.Title: “Beware asking Cipriani concierge for a water-taxi to Murano....”
Reviews.Author: BarryAscot
Reviews.Content: â€œDon't ask Cipriani concierge for a water-taxi to Murano.......â€� Watch out......Orient Express group's Cipriani in Venice have worst ever Concierge service, where concierge clearly set up guests up to be overcharged on Murano trips by factories that "co-operate" with the hotel. Hotel general manager has now admitted to me in an email which I have, that hotel only send guests to Murano factory/showrooms who â€œco-operateâ€�/pay hotel to â€œadvertiseâ€� by renting display cases in the hotel. We only asked Cipriani Concierge for a water-taxi as we wanted to stroll around the Island of Murano looking at various factories at our leisure. Instead, without telling us, Concierge had us collected by their favoured factory-of-the-day where we were (as potentially wealthy high spenders) expected and expertly handled. Our children were given VIP treatment, allowed to blow glass and then each given a small blue glass horse. I doubt that much if any of the glass displayed in the showroom is actually manufactured where this demonstration took place, which I suspect is just set up for tourists. We were then taken to a very special showroom full of high value items none of which are prices up....and given full-on attention. The glass items lovely.....huge glass horses/chandeliers/ art made of glass etc. The Murano showroom service was superb, they brought our tired and thirsty children water during the hours this took (in fact we did not see the light of day for hours). Some people would feel intimidated, even imprisoned. We had agreed to be taken around showroom by their salesman, having been given VIP treatment, gifts etc. It seemed only polite plus we were interestedâ€¦.and the glass was fantasticâ€¦â€¦but of course we had nothing else to compare it with, this being only showroom on Murano I had ever visited. I told my wife I did not have a clue as to what everything should cost and so before spending a great deal of money I called Cipriani concierge to check AND AS A CIPRIANI GUEST I SHOULD BE ENTITLED TO TRUST THEIR ADVICE. Cipriani concierge told me I could buy with confidence and prices would be special for me as I was a guest of the Cipriani. That they were! I later found that I could have bought similar Murano glass from another Murano factory that does not advertise with/â€�co-operate withâ€� the Cipriani for one third of the massive price I ended up paying. After complaining to Orient Express hotels, I ended up receiving a 50% refund from the glass factory. I only discovered the over-charge in the first place after I received a tip-off from a knowledgeable friend who is unimpressed with the Cipriani Concierge (but otherwise loves the hotel and stays often). As for the rest of the Cipriani, it is fantastic...food, service, atmosphere, pool everything although bedrooms are small.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: PBCLondon
Reviews.Content: Old school charm on a small island a short shuttle ride from San Marco. Peace and quiet, a welcome respite from the baying, heaving hordes. Excellent levels of service from a committed, friendly team of staff. Don't go expecting glitz, glamour and opulence as it's not that kind of building. Go for the sense of occasion, the peace and comfort, and the excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful haven away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: alexandradf
Reviews.Content: Was here in July for the famous Redentore feast with fireworks over the Grand Canal. Met friends for delicious frothy rum punch drinks by the pool and loved the peace and serenity of the hotel and manicured grounds and gardens. For my blog post about this property with personal photos, please visit my website at: http://www.destinationsperfected.com/2011/02/venice-italy-hotel-cipriani.html

Reviews.Title: “Pure Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Harrisuk81
Reviews.Content: A bit off the beaten track but well worth it. A shuttle boat takes you to all the action in minutes. Massive gardens, a real sense of tranquillity amongst the busy chaos of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A classic but with some drawbacks....”
Reviews.Author: miss_saigonlondon
Reviews.Content: I've meant to write this review for some time but I wanted to stay at a few more hotels just to make sure I was been objective. My husband says that only obnoxious people write reviews, I want to believe we write to help others make up their minds. My husband took me there on our 8th wedding anniversary and since I have never been to venice, he wanted to make it special and for special he guessed nothing beats the Cipriani.. We stayed for 4 nights at a suite on the palazzo side, right in front of the Piazza, everyday we had Venice right in front of us like in a movie. But now that I have already being to Venice and to The Cipriani I will not go back there. Reasons: Cipriani asks you to fork out an incredible amount of money for a suite and a compulsory half board,,, which we did not use and would not use. The suite is rather small and while the furnishing is sort of (faux) classical it could have done with some updating, specially the sofas. Also in most suites these days you see some appliances, nothing here. The location: if you want to explore venice, the romantic crossing becomes a hassle and if the weather is not nice, like one of the days we were there, then it means you do not have time to go back, shower and leave again. The food: we were not tempted to eat there based on their breakfast being so poor in terms of choice, the coffee was really bad, croissants dry, etc etc. I eat frugally at bfast but even here my frugality was impaired by the little choice. One day I ordered eggs and they were bad. We ate at some amazing places in Venice, after all, it is famous for its food. Spa: We had their signature massage there, again, nothing special (for almost E500). Service also was below par. We had made 2 reservations - which they confirmed beforehand- and while there they told us they did not know anything about them. So my husband, who speaks perfect italian, call the places himself and book. A few other things also happened but i will not bother you. I have been to Italy many times and stayed in many places, some were absolutely memorable, not this one unfortunately. Things I did like: the pool, the gardens, and the feeling that venice and its tourists were a movie.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely devine”
Reviews.Author: patentattorney
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly what it says it is , a five star hotel. We were upgraded to a junior suite which was superb. We had a terrace with sun loungers and dining table overlooking the pool. We had a bath tub which would accommodate 4 with an electric window above so you could see the sky/stars. needless to say the rest of the bathroom was fully marbled. The accent of this hotel was understated elegance. Sumptuous furnishings and excellent service without being too overbearing. You had to travel on a launch to get to St Marks square which took 5 minutes. The hotel overlooked venice so some rooms and restaurants had a fantastic view. We visited in October when it was not too hot and the place is less busy. This hotel enables you to have peace and tranquility ( and a large swimming pool) and have central venice whenever you wish. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “one of the world's greatest hotels but with a small reservation!”
Reviews.Author: MMK3
Reviews.Content: We spent threee nights here and loved it. Even though we had a special deal it is very expensive but for a significant anniversary we thought it was worth it: we were upgraded to a suite complete with complimentary prosecco and flowers in the room on arrival and the setting and food were outstanding. There were only two small drawbacks: firstly it was Venice Film Festival week and there was a handful of noisy, inconsiderate and frankly vulgar media types staying there which was tiresome; secondly the service, while generally excellent, was occasionally condescending and the front-of-house manager was quite offhand to our friends who had a complaint about their suite. However this didn't spoil our enjoyment of a great place. Incidentally I have read the complaint from another visitor about the 'adult time' at the pool and the fact that his/her children were made unwelcome. In fairness to the hotel the no-children period is clearly advertised and there is another little pool for them in the gardens at the rear. I'm not sure this kind of hotel is an appropriate choice of place to take children in any case. People paying upwards of 1000 euros a night don't always want them around, and there are other more suitable places to take them (and by the way I'm not anti-children, being an adoring grandparent myself )

Reviews.Title: “Old Fashioned Service & Glamour”
Reviews.Author: SpaceHopperSussex
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, the service at the Cipriani was outstanding. This is an old fashioned hotel in every way (including the decor and the majority of the guests) but this is what makes it feel very unique and special. Best place to be in Venice, quiet but close to all the action from the hotels launch - yes it is 'expensive' but in return is totally exclusive. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “The Cipriani Hasn't Lost Its Luster”
Reviews.Author: JeffOnUWS
Reviews.Content: My partner and I arrived in Venice by train following 5 nights in Rome. We took a water taxi to the hotel. Not having been in Venice for over 20 years, we were excited to be returning to the Cipriani - our 4th time there. It did not disappoint. As other posters have mentioned on this site, the first face you see upon arrival is that of Roberto, the hotel's "doorman", who has been at the hotel for 19 years. He is so friendly and so willing to assist you in any way he can. Reception was a snap. Kudos to Mario Z., who checked us into our beautiful lagoon view room with private balcony. Everything about the room was spectacular: the bathroom with skylight, the living area, ample closets, separate sleeping area, and that balcony. Service in and around the hotel was just right, gracious without being overbearing. The grounds are as beautiful as ever. The breakfasts on the terrace (which are included) were spectacular, including the chef whose only role seemed to be to carve prosciutto. Even though the room rates are staggeringly high, I would definitely recommend this hotel, particularly if you want to get away from the crowds in Venice. After a 5 minute "crossing" in the hotel's private motor launch, you feel as if you've been transported to your own private oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: IanMax
Reviews.Content: This is a superb hotel. It may be expensive but they do it with style. We could not find fault and Roberto, the doorman, seemed able to fix just about anything.. This is somewhere to stay at least once in your life.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC AND A MUST VISIT - ONLY DOWNSIDE WAS OUR STAY HAD TO COME TO AN END”
Reviews.Author: FAD_SF
Reviews.Content: The room was beautifully done and very nicely appointed. The grounds and setting are lovely. The staff responded to requests immediately (though there was not much that hadn't been considered before we thought to ask) and the service at the bar/restaurants/pool was outstanding - prompt without hovering. The food was delicious and very well prepared. Most importantly though were the other things that make a great stay an absolutely outstanding and memorable stay - the "teddy bear" cakes for the kids and fresh fruit for us when we checked into the rooms, the suggestion for non-alcoholic belinis for the kids every breakfast when they poured real ones or champagne for us, suggestions from the concierge on how to make the most of the trip which resulted in a FABULOUS day in a boat organized by the hotel complete with being met for private tours of Murano and Burano, the staff introducing themselves to the kids our first day and then taking the time to talk to them whenever they ran into them, Roberto who was so attentive and gave the girls "driving licenses" every morning then personally instructed the launch operator to be sure to let them drive the boat, the pool concierge who set up chairs for us when none were available together without being asked to do so and who gave us evian spray bottles to help us beat the heat wave even when we were simply walking by the pool to get somewhere else, the free kids club (and lovely Linda) which was so much fun the kids preferred it to hanging with us and we got to relax. I travel the world redularly for business and liesure and have stayed in some of the highest rated hotels in the world. This one definately rates up there with the best I have had the pleasure of visiting. Can not recommend it strongly enough.

Reviews.Title: “At Best a 3 Star Hotel at Beyond 5 Star prices. No Return Visit for Us.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBruin
Reviews.Content: This is a tough hotel to rate. I rarely give as poor a review as this one but at a price of 1,235 Euro at the low-end room rate, this is a "Poor" hotel and I don't mean poor in terms of lack of money. The rooms are all different but our suite was dated and reminded me of Ceasars palace in Las Vegas twenty years ago. The food was great. Most staff were very very nice but a few, as is always the case, snooty. The "High Speed" internet was non -existent in the rooms for all intents and purposes. The spa taff were great but the spa is underwhelming. Average gym equipment. In summary, this isn't a bad place to stay but not worth the money by any justification especially if you rate it primarily on the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful venue away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: UKSwallows
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Cipriani as part of a trip on the Orient Express with friends celebrating BIG Birthday/Retirement. Hotel across the Lagoon from St Marks Square. Private launch to transport you back and forth day and night. Lovely gardens, spacious elegant rooms. Excellent restaurant,if a little pricey! The bonus was a heated huge swimming pool,quite something in Venice. The only downside was it did not open until 9 am,so a swim before breakfast was not possible. Very friendly staff who were helpful arranging trips etc.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Hotel With 6 Star Staff”
Reviews.Author: redmanfloridapvb
Reviews.Content: It begins with a warm greeting from Roberto, who helped arrange a fabulous trip for us to Burano, to Gastone, a concierge who can make reservations at great resturants and get you museum tickets. As far as I'm concerned the word "can't" is not in their vocabulary. The young ladies who serve breakfast on the beautiful outdoor patio are outstanding. Have dinner at Cip's... the food was exceptional. It was a little chilly and the staff magically produced a shawl for my wife. Even the gardeners give you a buon giorno and are willing to answer any questions you may have about the flowers in the Casanova garden.The Cipriani is truly a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent from start to finish.”
Reviews.Author: BJPinGrange
Reviews.Content: This was a birthday present starting with a trip on the Orient Express, finishing with 3 nights at the Cipriani. Quality of room, service from all sections was excellent. Never had any problems when asking for advise and service from staff. Thanks for a wonderful birthday.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malcg
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights at the Hotel Ciprini and had a fabulous time there. 5 star hotels often have staff that provide an â€˜us and themâ€™ feeling but the Cipriani is different â€“ you are made to feel part of their family and yet the high standard of service is maintained throughout. The room was of a high standard with beautiful flowers and a welcoming bottle of Prosecco provided on arrival. The breakfast provided was excellent with friendly waiting staff and we even had the pleasure of eating outside on our last day as the sun was shining. We also had an evening meal in the hotelâ€™s Cipâ€™s Club restaurant and their Risotto was one of the finest we have tasted. The gardens of the hotel are fantastic and create an atmosphere of relaxation and the swimming pool is quite incredible â€“ heated and set in beautiful surroundings. Special mention must be made of 4 members of staff who looked after us so well â€“ Giampaolo Ottazzi, the General Manager; the lovely Laura di Bert, the Public Relations Manager; Mauro Foglietta, the Reception Manager and finally Roberto, the amicable doorman who greets you in his friendly manner everytime you arrive in the hotelâ€™s private boat â€“ he is great at advising you on the best way to spend your day and if you are lucky you may even hear his wonderful singing voice. We had a great time at the Cipriani and I would have no hesitation in recommending it to anyone who wants to spent a special time in Venice â€“ yes it may be expensive but you do get value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: AngeloMacca
Reviews.Content: The experience at the hotel starts with Roberto who greets you at the pier as if he's welcoming you in his house. One night we had dinner in a restaurant in he city and, since he went to a theatre around the corner and knew that we were there, he came inside just to say hello. The rooms are nice (especially the ones that has just been refurbished last winter) and extremely quiet; you don't have the noise of being on the Grand Canal. The maitre d' at Fortuny restaurant is very professional and remembers every name. The pool is amaizing; when I went it wasn't warm outside but the pool was almost 30 degrees celcius! Swimming in Venice was priceless!

Reviews.Title: “Cipriani, what a beautiful name!”
Reviews.Author: Gstaad320
Reviews.Content: Peace and Luxury descibe well this hotel, set a few minutes away by boat from Piazza St. Marco. Arriving at the Cipriani is a magical moment, it's a continuity of what you expect Venice to be. Beautiful and Special, indeed! Most important, you are welcomed by Roberto. The Cipriani woudn't be the Cipriani without him ! Roberto will be the one to make your stay Special. He knows the nice trattoria where you feel at home immidiatly, and will give you good ideas on what to see next. Cipriani's rooms are specious, and clean upon arrival, though I would suggest a bit more checking from the Gouvernante during the guest stay. Breakfast is incredible! The home made cakes to die for, as for the choice of cold cuts, it is perfect and generous in choice. Last but not least, the heated pool, with salt water, divine! Can't say anything about the Spa, we had no time! Venice has too much to see!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but stayed in better ones...”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteKreuzberg
Reviews.Content: super nice hotel, has everything you could possibly need or want one of the beaufitful hotels in venice, but there are definitely nicer ones .. a bit to old and conservative - you feel like at a museum...

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon destination”
Reviews.Author: ceepsprice
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel as part of our honeymoon experience staying at Lake Garda and then onto Venice. The actual hotel itself was incredible, very exclusive and felt like we were rubbing shoulders with the rich and famous. A private speedboat takes you from outside Doge's Palace to the actual hotel and the staff are very receptive and treat you like royalty (which can be quite un-nerving to normal folk!). The swimming pool was first class, a salt based swimming pool and the only one like it in Venice, everything about the hotel looked plush and aristocratic. This is what made the room seem a little out of place, it was quite standard and did not quite feel in touch with the rest of the place, don't get me wrong it was still perfectly acceptable but as we had just come from another hotel at Lake Garda that really did feel 5 star this was a bit of a let down. Overall lovely but in my opinion not worth the money, I would recommend just for the experience but I am sure there are better rooms in Venice for the prices paid.

Reviews.Title: “Magical weekend away”
Reviews.Author: T&P&Co
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cipriani for a long weekend to celebrate my wife's 30th birthday. We had an absolutely fantastic time, and although we realise the hotel is a lot of money - so "value" doesn't really come into the equation - we can't understand what so many of these negative reviews are complaining about. We arrived late one night having been greeted at the airport by a water taxi booked via the hotel. Despite it being almost midnight when we arrived, we were greeted off the boat by the concierge and shown to our fantastic Lagoon View room. Certainly no complaints about the roomâ€™s size, and the balcony ran the length of the room with a great view of the lagoon. The hotel is a fantastic spot to enjoy Venice from, as St Markâ€™s Square is only a short trip in the hotelâ€™s boat away. And once you have had enough of sightseeing, you can retire to the hotel which feels like a haven away from the hustle and bustle of Venice. We loved the outdoor swimming pool. We were generally lucky with the weather so were able to use it every day. We would, however, question the claim on the hotelâ€™s website that it is â€œOlympic sizedâ€�. Yes, it is very big, but we reckoned only about 35-40 metres. Michael Phelps, keep away. We enjoyed two breakfasts on the terrace and one inside due to a rain shower. There is no finer spot than the terrace to begin the day. The breakfast is buffet style but certain things, such as eggs, are cooked to order. We also dined in both of the hotelâ€™s restaurants which we would thoroughly recommend, especially the view from Cips towards St Markâ€˜s. We have stayed at one other Orient Express property - the Caruso on the Amalfi Coast. Both offer an unforgettable experience - for all the right reasons in our opinion - and we hope to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed blessings - very expensive ones”
Reviews.Author: incomfort
Reviews.Content: Generally described as the number one hotel in Venice, the Cipriani is a mixture. On the good side, it's quite different from the other main hotels in that, since it's located on Giudecca Island, it has the space to include quiet gardens and a huge swimming pool. (Note incidentally that many guide books and web sites call the island "Guidecca" and people therefore often pronounce it "guy-deck-a"; the people who live there, who ought to know, spell it "Giudecca" and pronounce it "jew-deck-a". Go look to see how reliable your reference site is!). The location is not a problem, indeed it's on balance an advantage. The hotel provides a shuttle boat service to St Mark's Square and the most you have to wait if you just miss the boat is 20 minutes. The shuttle boat is itself a delight (one of the beautiful polished wood variety, comfortable and indeed luxurious; so you get a free boat trip each time you move between the Square and the hotel). And whilst in the hotel you are in a separate world from the hurly burly of mainstream tourist Venice. The rooms are, like so many in Venetian hotels, mainly rather small. Not a problem if you want to spend your time being a tourist, but a major problem if you want "holiday time" in your room. By most people's standards this appears a good luxury hotel; by the standards of people who prefer the 5 star range it's pretty poor value with occasionally bad service. To achieve a reasonable (reasonable by non-Venice standards) room size one needs a luxury suite and thus a huge bank balance - Cipriani prices are high - very very high. One is looking at over Â£500 a night for a pokey little room and around Â£5,000 a night for more luxurious space. Not unreasonable prices perhaps if one obtains incomparable service but unfortunately while half the staff are wonderful, half are hopeless; whether you have a good experience or not will I guess depend on the nature of your problem and whether it's handled by one of the good ones or one of the "couldn't care" bad ones. A situation one meets in many hotels, but at lower cost. An example of what can make this feel a poor hotel: a four night stay; day 1 was a sunny morning and tables were laid up outside on the terrace and we breakfasted royally. Day 2 was sunny but no tables set up outside; we asked to eat outside and a table was quickly laid (and followed by others). Day 3 was sunny and we asked to eat outside and were told "No - it's too cold"! Personally I prefer to make my own judgements on whether it's too cold for me to eat outside. The waiter refused to lay up a table; a major fuss (and "major" meant insisting on the individual's manager being called, then that manager's manager through three layers of management) before we achieved, from resentful staff, our fresh air breakfast. But boy were they unhappy about it; most good hotel staff will bend over backwards to meet their guests' reasonable requests but this lot were focussed on their own priorities - an attitude difference which sets a good hotel apart from a bad hotel. On other occasions (including the first two breakfasts) one could not fault the restaurant staff - it just depends whether one is lucky enough to have a sensible soul helping one or a set of muppets. But at these prices one would expect the management to have got rid of the muppets and got rid of the occasional staff member who (fairly obviously) couldn't care less about guests. I went as a reconnaissance for a major party event with the firm and confident intention of basing the (six figure budget) party at the hotel; I left with the very firm intention of basing it elsewhere. My booking was cocked up (a confirmed-in-writing suite with balcony had no balcony), a promised water-taxi didn't arrive when needed and we endured the ghastly breakfast fiasco - the failures were enough to kill any thoughts of letting these people handle a key event. But seasoned travellers will know that it's quite possible for one person to endure a nightmare while another has a dream; hotels are like that. Would I recommend it to a friend? No; it's ludicrously over-priced for what it is. If you're a pop star and you need to keep the fans away and money's no object it would be fine. If you need to show off and persuade people you're somehow special and money's no object you'll be fine (though not too many people will notice you, Venice itself commands most people's attention). If you want an hotel with gardens and a pool don't go to Venice, you can get hugely better facilities and value elsewhere. If you want a comfortable luxury hotel as a base to visit Venice then go for Gritti Palace or Bauer or Danieli or your other choice of 5 star hotel; you'll get comfort and luxury at about half the price and your morning starting point will be the same as Cipriani's - right by St Mark's Square - and all you'll miss is the short boat ride. (Save on the hotel bill and with a very small part of the saving you'll be able to have a taxi ride or two each day). If you just want to feel superior and feel that you're better than the poor peasants, don't go to Venice, spend the money on counselling. Much of the Cipriani's reputation is based on the celebrities who've stayed there; for them a major benefit is the privacy of being away from the crowd whilst at the same time being "seen" to stay at the most expensive hotel. If you're a celebrity and can afford it then stay at the Ciptiani and get counselling. If you do decide it's worth it going to the Cipriani then try to get lucky and avoid the muppet staff, whom it would be invidious to name. But at dinner or breakfast if you bump into Mariana you'll be delighted (she's one of the good ones); at the jetty when arriving or waiting for the shuttle if you bump into Roberto you'll be delighted (he's the other good one!). If you decide against the Cipriani and you go for one of the other 5 stars you'll probably have a wonderful time (although that's not guaranteed). What is guaranteed is that you'll have a hugely bigger budget to spend on food, drink, private taxis and presents!

Reviews.Title: “Faded luxury - but in a good way”
Reviews.Author: DiMo
Reviews.Content: There's something more than a little dated about the Cipriani - whether it's the 70's style of the bedrooms and open spaces, or the other guests....However that's not necessarily a bad thing. The quality and attention to detail are high, but without the stuffiness or self-consciousness you can get at high-design hotels. The gardens, private launch, fabulous swimming pool and lagoon side breakfasts all make it worth it. But don't bother with the Fortuny restaurant: rather boring, overpriced and old-fashioned.

Reviews.Title: “No More!”
Reviews.Author: Leo516
Reviews.Content: After previous visits to the Cipriani for dinner when in Venice, last months was not the special occasion we remembered. Food very much the same as everywhere else, staff similar but of-course prices are much higher. When ordering cheese at the end of the meal, six small pieces arrived one of which you could see through. As a portion of cheese costs thirty euros, we asked for more of the gorganzola. When the bill arrived, a charge of ninety euros (about Â£80) for cheese was on the bill - this was rectified but not professionally. Past experiences were better with exceptional personalities (I remember one called Paolo) when even the pianist helped to make the evening memorable. With this still in our minds and with the rate of exchange being what it is - we won't be going again. Found good food elsewhere with extra cheese 'on the house'.

Reviews.Title: “What is the Big Deal?”
Reviews.Author: Charmingtoff
Reviews.Content: Originally planned 3 night stay as part of an engagement weekend but changed it to 1 and 2 nights at the Gritti Palace. Best decision i have made in a long while! Considering i was spending 3 times as much as a comparible room at the Gritti Palace i was expecting something really special. The launch to the hotel is shinny;the welcome was cordial but the hotel was just plain ordinary. We were upgraded to a suite which was beautiful but so it should be at just short of Â£2,000 per night!!!! This is silly money. The hotel is like a decent 3/4 star Mediterranean hotel nothing special. The grounds are disappointing which was a shame as i had to hastly rethink where i was going to propose to my girlfriend. (Outside St Marks at 1am was my late venue change). The pool is indeed splendid and much welcome after a hot day in Venice. The Bellini were dreadful. The Fortuny restaurant was not as elegant as it would like it to be thought it was and as it poured with rain we were faced with the rather dated interior of the restaurant which we eschewed for the much nicer (and much more pleasant and helpful head waiter) Cips which overlooks St Marks. Much more romantic though again at around Â£250 for dinner for 2 (which would cost half that in a top restaurant in London) one was left wondering was the experience that special. Whilst waiting for our table in the Fortuny restaurant we waited in the Bar next to it. No sooner seated were we informed that the Bar at 9.30pm was closing and we had to go elsewhere. To be fair the head waiter gave the young barman a talking to and we stayed but at this level we could buy the bar! So what are the upsides to the hotel. Not many. The launch was nice and romantic to summon it as 1am to cross over the lagoon to propose to my girlfriend. It is nice to escape to a pool on a hot summer's day with Venice so close. The rooms are beautiful but that i am afraid is that. Overall one is left with the sad feeling that one has been robbed. To pay Â£2,000 per night you expect something extraordinary. You dont get that. The Gritti is a third of the price and much more authentic and easier for sight seeing. I had been told the hotel launch would take you to the airport. Wrong. A water taxi takes you there which costs twice as much as if you had gone to St Marks and hailed it yourself! Even as we left one was left with a bad taste. I would probably return if somebody else was picking up the bill! Otherwise thanks but no thanks.

Reviews.Title: “dont waste your money on a place that doesnt deserve it”
Reviews.Author: mronion
Reviews.Content: venice is a beautiful place but this hotel doesnt do it justice. my second visit to venice but first to this property and i cannot emphasise the dissapointment i endurered. from the moment i stepped off the water taxi i was disspointed with all before me. first no concierge to help with the bags, dissapointing rooms irrespective of the price, when you factor in the price (2,400 euros per night) even more depressing. food by the pool dissapointing, at least there was a pool and not to crowded. would recommend the ca'sa gredo hotel for anyone above this place, better rooms and friendlier atmosphere. cipriani obviously has an awesome publicity machine selling this average property. a few bulgari cosmetics in the bathroom does not make up for the other faults.

Reviews.Title: “Poolside buffet - wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Farnham_SurreySarah
Reviews.Content: We had been recommended to go to the pool side restaurant and have the buffet. 29 Euros each but the food was delicious and a lovely setting. We took a good 2 hours over our lunch and felt totally unhurried. Very nice, discreet staff. I would avoid the other restaurants in the hotel as they are very expensive but I felt this was good value (for Venice!). You catch the complimentary boat from S.Marco over to the hotel. We spent an hour in the gardens before hand - beautifully scented buy jasmine everywhere. A lovely half day

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: junoman973
Reviews.Content: I was able to get a away for an afternoon and check out this amazing hotel. I work for a fashion company and want to use this hotel for future business. The rooms were beautiful and kept very well. The pool and grounds are beautiful, and lunch was really nice. This hotel is in a wonderful location and gets you away from the crowds of Venice. If you are looking for something extra special this is the place to stay. If you go during the summer dont forget the bathing suit, the pool was gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “A special hotel”
Reviews.Author: serenissimaLondon
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel in an amazing location away from the chaos of Venice. It is calm and relaxing and a great place to go with children. Ours loved the pool and the boat trips to San Marco as well as the very friendly staff, especially Roberto. Sightseeing can be hard work with small children but the Cipriani made it easy and fun.

Reviews.Title: “They treated us like friends and family”
Reviews.Author: sheilabluemouse
Reviews.Content: The hardest part to describe our experience would be find the right words. My wife and I will always be grateful to Giampaolo Ottazzi and his staff for treating us as part of family. What better thing to say. Not only is this a 5 star facility and panorama, but the service from eveyone there was so sincere and warm as they help you with whatever you need. My wife and I have travelled extensively, and there is no better on the planet. Venice is spectacular, and The Cipriani adds to the experience. The brand of Cipriani is a great calling card in town, opening doors, tables, etc

Reviews.Title: “Unqiue hotel, not necessarily worth the hype”
Reviews.Author: bobd72
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to stay at the Hotel Cipriani and finally had the chance when my fiancee and I took a quick trip to Venice in September of 2008...The hotel is on an island away from the hustle and bustle of Venice...There is a shuttle that takes guests back and forth to St Mark's Square...The hotel is finished in an understated, classical fashion...The rooms are finished in a similiar style and, quite frankly, could use a bit of touch up...The hotel has lovely grounds and a beautiful and large pool...The restaurant is very good and is regarded as one of the best in Venice...Service is refined and very good...Venice itself is incredible...True it is touristy, crowded and expensive but it is a place that one has to visit...The Cipriani is definitely unique, has amazing grounds and provides a haven on tranquality away from the crowds of Venice but did not live up to my (very high) expectations...Subsequent to our stay, my wife stayed at the San Clemente Palace...She said that she liked that more and provided much better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “An Unreal Experience!”
Reviews.Author: JLove2512
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Cipriani is one of those hotels that cannot be overrated. No matter what you think you might experience when booking this hotel, you'll be impressed. I stayed in this hotel with my daughter for her graduation present and it was absolutely amazing. From the welcome champagne in the room to the free water taxi to the piazza san marco, the spacious room, awesome breakfast and lovely staff, we couldnt have asked for more. The price was WELL WORTH IT and this is the best way to spend a vacation in Venice. One of the, if not THE, most amazing hotel we stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Everyone but Definitely for Me”
Reviews.Author: nowvoyager1
Reviews.Content: This time only an overnight stay for a business meeting rather than an extended break. I love it and yes it has its failings but it can never be accused of being sterile or chain like, that's what makes it so special. This was a stay in one of the smaller Garden Rooms but it was fine, nice view, bottle of Prosecco, summer flowers and spotless. Staff remember you from previous visits and enquire about family members so I have never experienced what some other of your respondents consider to be an unfriendly approach. The pool is my favourite in the world and thankfully they keep children contained and under control, if only this were the case everywhere. It is central to the experience and immaculately maintained and serviced, Dinner at Cip's was excellent and can that view be bettered? No I don't think it can. Excellent Negronis before at the Fortuny Bar with great service, again greeted by name by the staff. Could do with a bit of redecoration here and there but it is distinguished and I don't think it rests on its laurels, it is Establshment old school and none the worse for that.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: mumof6
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Cipriani to celebrate my husbands birthday, we try to stay somewhere luxurious every year - without the children! From the moment we arrived we were made to feel like royalty, we stayed in a suite in the Palazzo Vendremin which included our own butler ( well shared between 3 rooms on the same floor but you never knew that he had anyone else to look after) and a delightful lounge area. The butler unpacked for us while we went to get a drink after the journey and what a joy it was to come back to the room and find everything spotless and hung up! Each evening he would set up the silver for our breakfast in the lounge area, I had a full english breakfast which set me up for the whole day! My husband ordered both full english and continental and then took his rolls with him wrapped up to snack on while I dragged him around Venice! As a bonus the breakfast is included in the price. I have to confess that I found the food to be overrated and very expensive, but with your own motor launch leaving for the main square every 20 minutes there is no excuse for not getting out and trying some of the fantastic fare that is on offer in Venice. It rained one day while we were there and the butler found Cipriani brollies for us so that we wouldnt get wet whilst wandering around Venice, which I have to admit acted like a magnet for all of the glass tour touts at the square! Yes it is a bit faded, but having stayed in luxury hotels all over the world, I have to say that the Cipriani has a charm all of its own, I wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Cipriani was very disapointing- Families not welcome”
Reviews.Author: travelingmumCanada
Reviews.Content: We had spent a month travelling around Europe with a group of 10 family members including our baby. Everywhere else we stayed people went out of there way to make us feel welcome and comfortable but the Cipriani was a very disapointing last stop. Our group had 4 suits booked together but when we arrived we were told that one of the rooms was in a different building. We said we'd like to be close to my parents and my sister would like the other building. The reception very bluntly said "no" and took us to the far away room. As we walked we were told the hotel rules, Children are not allowed in the fitness center (as with most hotels,this makes sense for safety but I didn't think we really needed to be told in that way) Children are not allowed in the business center and if my son askes to use the internet he will be told no ( I really doubt my baby would be asking to use the internet) Children are not allowed in one restaurant and are only allowed in the other for dinner between 7:30 and 9 and are only allowed in the pool during certain hours. I felt like we were getting a lecture of all the things children are not allowed to do rather than being told about the services of the hotel. The room itself had a nice balcony with a private hot tub but it was very dated and dark with stained pink carpet and duct tape holding the tv cabinet together. At 7;45 we tried to go for dinner but were told that children are not allowed in after 7:30. We tried to order room service but were told he was busy with another room and he'd call us back. He did call back 35 minutes later and when the food came an hour after that it was okay. Since there are not many choices of places to eat without taking a boat we ordered room service 3 times during our stay and every time we had to wait to be called back and 2 out of the 3 times they forgot part of our order. The low point of our stay was the next afternoon when our group were the only ones in the restaurant and I was discreetly nursing my son. The waited asked if I wanted to "do that inside" I replied no thanks we're fine here and he huffed "I ment for the other guests" What guests? we were the only ones in there. He then proceded to walk around the table opening and handing menus to everyone,but when he got to me he literelly threw it at me. I realize that some people are just not comfortable with nursing in public but I don't think anyone deserves to have a menu thrown at them under any circumstances! I wish I had complained right there but I was so tired of being treated like we were not welcome there,I was trying not to cry and I still had to feed my hungry baby so my husband, son and I just left. We were there for 4 days and aside from one friendly housekeeper not one staff member said hello or even smiled at us. The bad service and disorganization contiuned the day were leaving. We got a call early in the morning saying we needed to check out now or we wouldn't make our flight. We explained that our flight wasn't until 5 and we had been gauranteed a late check out through American Express. At 9 we got another call saying the same thing., we explained again but got yet another call asking what time we would be leaving, we said 1:15 and asked to have help with our luggage.At 1:25 no one had come so we called to see if they were coming and were told they were busy and would be there soon. We needed to catch our transfer to the airport and were heading down the stairs with our luggage ourselves when they did finally show up at around 1:40. We were so glad to leave! I don't know if we would have been treated differently if my son had not been with us but if a hotel doesn't want kids there they should state that so families can stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “In the future I'm going not going to stay there anymore”
Reviews.Author: RosiS
Reviews.Content: The only thing I liked there is the location of the hotel. It is just magical to take the hotel boat anytime of the day and drive over to St. Marcs Square. On the other hand - for the kind of money they're asking, I really expect it to be better. I gave them a "second chance", but I think next time I'm going to look for another place in Venice. The room wasn't that clean, for example: the toilet was still dirty. The mirrors in the bedroom had clearly visible marks on them and the cleaning personal just discovered this after the second night. We were surprised not to have a hairdryer in the bathroom and were told, it's not part of the usual furnishings of the room..... The staff might be unintrusive - I would call it arrogant, mostly elderly men are working the reception and the service at dinner. The younger women are apparently only "allowed" to work the breakfast shift. Breakfast nothing special, I know Italians eat very light at breakfast, but with the clientel being mostly international, one would expect a better selection. Overall disappointing. During the season the hotel has a good occupancy rate, so they think they don't have to try hard anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Magic on the Lagoon”
Reviews.Author: Drapeaued
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating our anniversary and decided to take the plunge and stay at the Cip and Vendremin. We were greeted warmly by Virglio and shown to the accomadation that we had booked directly with M. Rusconi. True to our arrangements, we were shown to a beautiful junior suite in the Palazetto with a view toward St Marks. All was well as we dined our first night at Fortuny on the terrace - grand meal and fine wine. Upon return to our room my wife entered the bathroom and to her surprise, found that the plumbing above had sprung a leak and that water was pouring out of the ceiling light fixtures. Within perhaps two minutes of advising the front desk of this emergency, and we in our robes and slippers, were whisked to a grand suite in the Palazzo Vendremin with the staff packing our belongings behind us. The next day we were offered the choice of staying in the Palazzo or returning to the Palazetto. We chose the latter. The handling of the event with ablomb and grace was indicative of the level of service and concern that this hotel shows its guests.
