The remainder of our stay was magical- delightful dinner at Cip's Club with excellent polla ala diavolo, great lunch at Gabbiano by the pool, an excursion for some golf on the Lido, and just the joy of the trips to and from Bassano San Marco on the hotel's launch. We had drinks at the bar one evening to find George Clooney present being showered with gifts from his entourage. But every one of the hotel guests was discreet and never bothered him. This is the place to go and relax- sit by the pool if the mood strikes you, or walk along the canal for some gelato in the afternoon, and the major attractions of Venice are a glorious brief boat ride away. We will return again and again and cannot resist the allure of this place.

Reviews.Title: “easily the best hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: kryptonic
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights to celebrate a special occasion, looked at the other 5 stars i.e Luna Baglione, the Bauers, San Clemente, Danieli, Gritti etc., although the Cipriani is the most expensive decided to check out to find if it lives up to it's reputation-it does! I just can't understand how it's #94 on Tripadvisor list. From the moment we boarded the private launch(free at all times-and runs 24 hours a day) from San Marco ~ Guidecca to the moment we left it was absolutely fantastic. The accommodation standards were extremely high, the suite had a large main bedroom with motorised retractable 40"LCD TV at foot of bed, large sitting room with secondary LCD, and very large bathroom again with LCD TV built into wall of bathroom. The Pool area is an oasis- a 25 metre saltwater pool for relaxation after a day in Venice, and there's a nice pool bar overlooking the lagoon, the gardens are very typical and there are vines which supply grapes for the local wine. We dined at Chips club twice, which is a lovely romantic location overlooking the lagoon, food quality is high. Breakfasts are the best I have had at any hotel! Highlight are the staff , most of whom have there for many years, they are not at all snooty and treated us very well, a special mention for Corinne, who was very helpfull on arrival, Walter and Ottavio at the pool bar, and all the other staff. The concierges were extremely helpfull , booked us our Taxi to return to airport(highly recommended), charged no commision for this service whatsoever. I met other regular and first time customers of the Cipriani, and they all had similar opinions, many of whom commented that this was one of the best hotels in the world. The Cipriani is an expensive hotel which lives up to and beyond its reputation. I would highly recommend it and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Down on it's Cips”
Reviews.Author: fioreinglese
Reviews.Content: As Mark Twain said, it is better to travel than to arrive, and given the reputation of this hotel, arrival was a huge disappointment. We have stayed at top hotels all over the world and have been to Venice 8 times, so we do not have unrealistic expectations, here is a quick summary of what we found. We booked a Junior suite for the night, which at 1600 euros a night you ought to expect a reasonable standard of accomodation, even in expensive Venice. The hallway to the room was a long dark corridor, done floor to ceiling in sponged peach circa 1980 something, with peach carpet which had that sticky feeling you get from carpets so old no amount of cleaning can remove the gunge. The room was at the back of the hotel, overlooking a patchy muddy lawn and motheaten hedge with a dirty white plastic wedding marquee left standing in it permanently (the garden). The bathroom had the same plastic bath your grandmother has in her bungalow (peach with handles to pull yourself up if your knees are bad), a square box hairdryer which I last saw in a municipal pool in the 1970s, with the squeegy air tube ripped and broken, a vanity mirror with rust stains around the edge and every time I hung the towel up it fell into the toilet below. The toiletries were ancient looking and were probably used last by Agatha Christie to talc her bloomers. I then asked very firmly but politely to be moved to another room. We were given apologies (eventually) and told that the hotel was "in the process of being refurbished" and shown another room. This was tastefully furnished, had a private terrace on the roof above with a panoramic view of the Grand Canal to die for and a large bathroom, it was just what we thought we should have been given in the first place. When I booked the room I was told we couldn't request a particular room. When we left I asked if we could have the nice room again and were told that they always try to accomodate repeat customers. So, if its your first and only time, beware, and don't let them fob you off with the stale fag end of the hotel. On the plus side (!) the staff had a proper old fashioned polite and accomodating at your service ethic, attentive without being intrusive, the pool was pure Hollywood gorgeousness and the breakfast room with ripples of water reflected on the ceiling as you gaze straight out over the canal was magic. So don't expect faded glory charm, its too tired to even achieve that, but if you can put up with the feeling that Farah Fawcett is likely to come bounding out of the fake white trellis in the wine bar, it does grows on you and I have to say I would stay there again, albeit in the knowledge there are some better rooms than others.

Reviews.Title: “Super romantic”
Reviews.Author: Wereldreizigster
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely suite in Palazzo Vendramin with a little garden and a kitchen.. Beautiful marble bathroom with all the amenities you could wish for even sun tan lotion and candles! Out of this world...

Reviews.Title: “A Classic”
Reviews.Author: lebonvivant
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed tremendously our three-day Honeymoon package (Jr. Suite/one spa treatment per person/breakfast and one other meal included per day). At USD 6,500, it was certainly very expensive but this is attributable to the USD/Euro exchange rate. Much of what we experienced has been articulated many times in this space by others. To these observations, I add my recommendation that you book a suite rather than one of the standard rooms because the suites, though more expensive, represent, by all accounts, a better value because they are so much nicer than the standards. Ours was actually a large apartment steps from the pool where we found our reserved lounge chairs - a decadent treat. Generally, the property lives up to its legendary reputation: The pool is the best in the world - Olympic-size, nearly empty, filtered salt water heated during our stay to 86 degrees fahrenheit. The food is flawless. The atmosphere is blissfully quiet and the grounds spacious (for central Venice!) and perfectly manicured. Small quibbles: the bed linens were scratchy and somewhat worn, though absolutely clean (as was everything else). The single-ply toilet paper was also a down-market touch, though perhaps a result of a plumbing system which might not handle anything more substantial. The Hotel Cipriani Venice is our current worldwide favorite. So long as you will not bemoan the cost, don't hesitate to book a suite here.

Reviews.Title: “No such thing as a free launch”
Reviews.Author: RubiaLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cipriani for our second time in April 2007. The setting is truly sublime. Our room was gorgeous. The staff very helpful. Breakfast divine. The Cipriani added that truly memorable quality to our 5-day holiday. No further description is necessary, as the Cipriani has been well described by other reviewers. Suffice to say it does deserve a high rating but not 5 stars for the following reason. Beware of the concierge desk. We asked advice about where we should go to see genuine glass blowing and the production of Murano glass. We were told that they [the hotel] could organise exactly what we were after. 10:00 the next morning was the agreed departure time. We anticipated going to Murano on the hotelâ€™s private launch. A â€˜complimentaryâ€™ water taxi from the glass works however was what awaited us. This set the first alarm bell ringing. We had a lovely trip up through the back canals and then across to Murano. We arrived at the private jetty of the Cam s.r.l. glass works and were greeted effusively by a well-suited member of staff. The next 10 minutes were what weâ€™d hoped for. We were shown around a modest gritty production area where 4 guys were making vases and pieces for chandeliers. We saw glass blowing and were able to appreciate the skill & techniques involved. We were not permitted to linger though and were rushed off to the next section of the â€˜tourâ€™. A louder alarm bell began to clang. What then followed was the worst 50 minutes of highly polished hard sell we have ever experienced. We were lead through seven or eight sales rooms chock full of every imaginable object in glass. We were put under extreme pressure to buy a â€˜family heirloomâ€™ at massively bloated prices. (i.e. â‚¬10k for a chandelier â€“ Iâ€™d prefer a Picasso sketch!). When it became clear to our guide that we were not interested in parting with excessive amounts of money for a piece of Murano glass his attitude became rude and dismissive, and we were made to feel most uncomfortable. We declined the return launch. Back at the Cipriani we complained vociferously at the manner in which we had been treated. We had asked for a simple recommendation that had resulted in a most unpleasant time so we pressed the manager to investigate what his staff were recommending and why. Apart from that hiccup we LOVE the Cipriani and the wonderful â€˜get away from it all feelâ€™ that it provides. Itâ€™s a special place. But we suggest you make your own way to Murano, and be canny about which glassworks you choose to visit!

Reviews.Title: “Average at best...”
Reviews.Author: amwerewolfinlondon
Reviews.Content: We were expecting so much after hearing about the Cipriani... but we were sadly disappointed. Although the pool was gorgeous and the hotel was clean, it was far from what we consider luxurious. The so called "garden" was small and boring. The room was pretty small for the amount of money we spent. Service was good but not excellent. I guess this is a great place to go if you don't want to be around other tourists - it was definitely nice to get away from the bustle of Venice, but I wouldn't consider it as luxurious as people say. The food was the Cips Club was excellent. The breakfast was just ok... also expected more. They do offer a free shuttle water taxi b/t Venice and the hotel. But when we asked about water taxi to the airport we were told it was 140 euro. It is really 90 euro but they charge an extra 50 euro for what they said was a "shuttle" from the dock to the airport itself (yes a bit of a walk but nothing worth 50 euro!!). We asked for a reg water taxi and saved the 50 euro.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: arbogast
Reviews.Content: The Cipriani is one of the high points of our civilization. I cannot think of a better-located, more elegant or comfortable hotel in the world. I will never stay at any other hotel in Venice. It is expensive but extremely beautiful, authentic and luxurious. The swimming pool is stunning and can there be a more delightful or decadent way to spend a day than to spend it by the pool at the Cipriani followed by a delicious lunch looking over the canals of Venice? One very small fly in the ointment is the rather fed-up and dismissive attitude of some of the staff but others more than make up for it by being very helpful. Try to avoid staying in the Vendramin - the main building is much better.

Reviews.Title: “VERY romantic and glamorous”
Reviews.Author: Globbo
Reviews.Content: We had a one-bedroom suite with two balconies and a view of the lagoon - what could be better than that? The hotel's not inexpensive, but it's got the service and the accommodations to back up the price, at least by Venice's standards. Also, the buffet breakfast was absolutely decadent. Perhaps the best spread I've ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing. But be prepared.”
Reviews.Author: JT14
Reviews.Content: I considered rating this a 4 rather than a 5 but the imperfections of the Cipriani are not really the point of it. It is the most beautiful hotel in an incredible city. The physical space and environment that it allows guests is a perfect balance to the dense streets of Venice. The gardens and pool are beautiful. I completely recommend the hotel. BUT - you need to go in the right frame of mind. It is expensive (â‚¬1000 per night) for a very normal size room (which manages be 30 years since refurbishment without being worn out - how I don't know). The front desk staff are stuffy, borderline rude. However, in my experience the majority of Italian high-end hotels have the same problem. The compensation is that you leave feeling you have had a unique experience. Increasingly difficult in the world of Four Seasons. I would not stay anywhere else in Venice if you are up for the price. I personally don't see the attraction of being in the centre of the City when you can cross the lagoon from the Cipriani in 10 minutes. The other 5* hotels (mostly a Starwood clique) are cheaper but the Cipriani is better value. Other points. Breakfast is great - especially if you sit outside. Dinner in the restaurant is disappointing plus they have a jacket and tie dress code which is annoyingly not enforced (better not to have it - so irritating to have to put on a tie and then see that everyone else can ignore it). Eat out - food and ambiance is better. Spa is good (but not top standard). In summary, fantastic. But if you are irritated by imperfect rooms, high prices and snotty staff, best to avoid. In fact, you probably shouldn't go to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Cipriani”
Reviews.Author: dee090
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hotel Cipriani. It did meet all our expectations. We had booked the "venetian interlude" package direct with the hotel which includes a junior suite, breakfast plus one other meal of your choice each day, plus a beauty treatment. Our room on the third floor had a terrace and overlooked the lagoon which was lovely. Marble bathroom with 2 sinks, standard size bath and a wonderful walk- in shower. We had dinner at the formal restaurant and at the Cips, and had lunch at the pool side restaurant. The food at all of these restaurants was very good indeed. The service is professional and friendly without being stuffy or indifferent. For a total cost of 130 euros, the hotel arranged for us to be met at the airport on arrival, driven to the watertaxi stand and taken by a private watertaxi direct to the hotel. I know it may be cheaper to DIY but the ease of having yourself plus luggage transported for you to and into the watertaxi from the airport is, in my opinion, an amount worth spending (especially if you have heavy/bulky luggage) The beauty treatments were excellent and lovely to have after a day of walking around and sightseeing. The outdoor heated swimming pool is wonderful and fortunately we had some great weather so we could enjoy swimming and lounging. Some of the suites have loungers specifically allocated to them - but if you are not in one of these suites, the pool attendant is more than happy to move unreserved loungers to wherever you want them around the pool. I would definitely recommend this hotel . Yes it is expensive and so not worth going to if you are going to faint at the price of a gin and tonic (24 euros by the way). Only one thing I would suggest to anyone going there and planning to have dinner in CIPs. We had intended eating at CIPs the first night and the formal restaurant the second night (which was our wedding anniversary). It was raining on the first day/night, however, and when we arrived we were told that the earliest we could have dinner in the CIPS restaurant would be 9-9.30pm. As we had been up since 4am we didn't want to eat that late. The restaurant could not accommodate us any earlier as the outside terrace was not open on account of the weather and the inside part of the restaurant was already fully booked. In the end we swapped over and ate in the formal restaurant the first night instead which was able to accommodate us at 8pm. So it was not a problem for us. However, if you are planning to dine on the first night you arrive and are specific about when you want to eat - you may want to contact the hotel in advance to reserve a table at a specific time. A very special hotel - whether it is a "once in a lifetime" treat or a regular break.

Reviews.Title: “Fabuolus in every way”
Reviews.Author: Hackney13
Reviews.Content: We had no hesitation in booking the Cipriani based on its reputation alone despite some slightly negative reviews on this site. Main complaints seem to refer to the size and quality of the rooms. Based on our experience this is entirely groundless. We had a lovely standard room which was more than big enough for two people and a bathroom which was not huge but perfectly well appointed. The standard of decor in both was absolutely excellent with no complaint whatsover - although obviously you have to understand this hotel is decorated in a very classical style and there are no smart, sleek, modern, minimalist features. Yes it is expensive but so is everywhere in Venice but for us, the room, location (ie away from the hubbub of the main islands but with very easy access), facilities and above all, service, made it worth every penny. Every single member of staff went out of their way on every occasion to be friendly and very helpful. The buffet breakfast was fabulous and more than enough to see us through to pre dinner nibbles. We didn't eat in the hotel other than breakfast but heard from other guests and visitors that the food was excellent. It was too chilly for us to use the pool but it looked gorgeous and the one evening we went to the bar for a nightcap, there was a fantastic pianist playing which created a wondeful atmosphere. We have stayed in some excellent hotels around the world (several One & Only properties, the Santa Caterina in Amalfi etc) and found the Cipriani to be on exactly the same par and would highly recommend it to anyone. The only caution I would give is to bear in mind you do need to take a shuttle boat back and forth from the hotel to the main islands and if you are the sort of person who likes to pop back to your room throughout the day, this could be a drawback. Also, because of the geographic location of the hotel, none of the rooms (apart from one particular suite) affords a view over St Mark's Square or the Grand Canal - not a major problem, but worth knowing.

Reviews.Title: “Legendary but a tad disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I wanted to try the legendary Cipriani with my wife and 2 1/2 daughter. Our impressions and advice below. - It is worthwile taking the motoscafo service from the airport directly to the hotel's pier; - after the enchanting journey, we got a bit disappointed upon arrival because we had to wait for 30 minutes before they could make a room available to us - the room was large enough but the electricity (very confusing switches - even the room service guy was at pains getting TV on and most of lights off at the same time!) and bathrooms are disappointing and the room decoration was not that impressive - the setting of the hotel is quite extraordinary, although the rear gardens are not as nice as they look on the website or in the brochure (an ugly large permanent "tent" for hosting seminars/weddings seems to be pÃªrmanently laid on the grass) - excellent and very dedicated staff in the restaurant, - wonderful breakfastfast; lunch and diner are fine but overpriced; bar and minibar are outrageously expensive. Conclusion: a legendary spot indeed but unless you go for the suites you might find it disappointing value.

Reviews.Title: “magnifico experience at Cipriani”
Reviews.Author: mauna_kea_lady
Reviews.Content: a once in a lifetime experience that we intend to make a once in a year experience! exceptional in Every regard, beyond our expectations (which were very high). staff was highly professional - helpful, accomodating, and friendly. the grounds, rooms, food, service, pool, setting, spa, views..etc were as beautiful and pleasant as a fantasy. I had to keep pinching myself to make sure I wasn't dreaming. all the top hotels in Europe are expensive, especially with the dollar against the euro. this is one of those hotels to splurge on - it will be a peak experience that you will cherish for your entire life. we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “spectacular”
Reviews.Author: just up and go
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cipriani in early September and it was one of the most wonderful experiences of my life. The room was lovely and overlooked the lagoon, the pool was spectacular (I had no problem with attitude; some of the chairs were reserved but that was about it), the staff courteous, friendly and efficient and the food amazing. I agree that Cip's Club is the better of the two restaurants for dinner, but they were both excellent. The breakfast is one of the best I've ever had. Best of all is the fact that the Cipriani is a short boat ride away from the huge crowds in St. Mark's Square. It is such a lovely respite from the hordes of cruise ship tourists that are discharged every day. Yes, it is expensive, but it was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular setting, but the poolside attitude!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was dismayed on a very hot, busy day at the poolside, when asking the steward for a sun lounger and noticing empty loungers without towels, to be told "oh no, what is your room number? Oh you cannot sit there". I suppose we had only booked a standard room for 5 nights, but was not aware this affected where you could sit at the poolside. Everything else about the hotel was perfect.
